author: {'steamid': '76561198034273720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1708887070}
review:
[h1]MADAME FATE HAS PREDICTED HER OWN DEMISE🔮CAN I FIND THE MURDERER IN TIME OR IS HER FATE ALREADY SEALED?[/h1]
Madame Fate is the fourth game in the Mystery Case Files series. I decided to replay the entire series, and it has given me a whole new perspective watching new features unfold with each new release.

Mystery Case Files: Huntsville wasn't just the first game in this series; it was the first Hidden Object game of its kind... EVER, and it gave birth to the Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure genre. 
 
Let's do a recap...

[b]MYSTERY CASE FILES: HUNTSVILLE[/b] 
You begin this game as an ordinary detective, but as you apprehend each of the 14 members of the S.T.A.I.N Organization, you'll climb the ladder to become the infamous Master Detective...Fun Fact: The Master Detective was a female detective in the earlier games! 

Huntsville was a diamond in the rough. The scenes were grainy and jam-packed with an abundance of ordinary objects, some of which were extraordinarily tiny. With just 3 Hints per chapter, you are tasked with finding 8 objects per scene and completing a repetitive square tile-swapping game within a given time frame.

[b]MYSTERY CASE FILES: PRIME SUSPECT[/b] 
After becoming a Master Detective in Huntsville, I was sent to the Capital City Piazza Gallery in the United States to find the culprit who had stolen the Queen's Hope Diamond.
 
Big Fish Studios debuted Prime Suspects a year later on April 5, 2006, and reported record-breaking sales of 3.3 games per minute! Just as in its predecessor, Huntsville, you are tasked with searching for clues in locations across the town in the form of Hidden Object Scenes. There are 22 Levels that take place over 29 different locations. Each level requires the player to search a handful of locations that have 8 listed objects per scene within the allotted time (which varies depending on the number of locations)
 
They added a fourth Hint and a new feature requiring you to find a Battery that unlocks two different HO varieties. A device to search items in the dark using a flashlight or a device to search through walls using a magnifying glass device. They added two new mini-games and designed the game to have different items to search for every time you replay the game.
 
[b]MYSTERY CASE FILES: RAVENHEARST[/b] 
Mystery Case Files takes a supernatural twist! Her Majesty The Queen has asked me to investigate the unsettling rumors surrounding Ravenhearst Manor. My mission is to find the missing diary pages of Emma Ravenhearst, but first I'll have to solve a series of bizarre Door Locks placed by Charles Dalimar. Was Charles trying to keep someone from getting in...or out?
 
Ravenhearst marks the beginning of the Dalimar legacy and Master Detective's nemesis for many future Mystery Case Files games. A fifth Hint has been added, and a new Diary Entry puzzle of rotating & placing fragmented pieces.
 
The most notable difference in Ravenhearst is with the introduction of the infamous Rube Goldberg puzzles. Charles Dalimar may be long gone, but he still haunts you with a series of maddening locks. These are Rube Goldberg puzzles that require thinking & tinkering. Click on anything and everything until you find codes or clues as to how to solve each section. These puzzles may seem impossible to figure out at first glance, but the solutions are logical; they just have bizarre and creepy graphics.
 
[b]MYSTERY CASE FILES: MADAME FATE[/b] 
Madame Fate has foreseen the future from within her Crystal Ball, and it has predicted her demise at the stroke of midnight. Determined to change her fate, she has asked Master Detective to investigate each of the 15 Carney's to find her murderer.

Mystery Case Files: Madame Fate is finally beginning to look more like a HOPA with the introduction of animated graphics, Hot Spot Zoom Zones, Brain-teaser Word puzzles, Rapid Clicking ability (you can now click on items back-to-back without having to wait), 5 Hints with the ability to earn more (and the ability to earn additional time on the timer), a Hot Line Phone to skip Crystal Ball Puzzles, and my favorite feature of all time...Morphing Objects.

[b]Hotspots-Zoom Zones[/b]
Some locations have a sub-scene that takes you to an additional HO scene. These levels have a slight glow around them on the Map, and you can enter the hotspot by clicking on the area with sparkles. Many of the listed items within the hotspots are listed in the form of a riddle or require an interactive task, such as "A Happy Devil," meaning you have to find an item to drag to the devil to make him happy.  

[b]Mysterious Changing Items-Morphing Objects[/b]
On the level map, you will notice that some locations have a purple Question Mark icon. These are the scenes that have a Morphing Object in either the main scene, the hotspot scene, or both. Finding Mystery Changing items will unlock additional secret locations integrated into the next chapter (click the Attractions tab > Mystery Items tab to see the required amount). The secret locations allow you to earn extra time on the clock as the clock goes backward with every item found. Finding Mystery Items will also give you an additional Hint.

[b]Word Puzzles[/b]
There are several types of Word games available:
-Ten From Seven: Form 10 seven-letter words from the letters in the center.
-Six 2 Win: Form 6 words that are related to each other (weather, birds, bathroom items, etc.) by swapping letters.
-Attraction: Swap letters to form 2 words that have opposite meanings. (Negligent & Diligent)
-Rocket Dog: Guess three different words by clicking on letters. You get six guesses for each word. If you guess correctly, the letter fills in the blank spots in the correct placement. If you guess a letter that isn't in the word, one of the six rings will disappear. I loved this hangman-type game!

[b]Crystal Ball Puzzles[/b]  
These are the infamous Rube Goldberg "door puzzles" first introduced in Ravenhearst. These are tricky puzzles, and I had to consult a walkthrough for several puzzles to figure out what I was supposed to do. Once I figured out what I was supposed to do, I could usually figure out how to solve it. I completed every puzzle but one. I had to use the Phone Hotline to skip the puzzle where you click on squares to change each square to assemble the correct cat picture. I was able to solve every picture with the exception of the lion's face. I would get all the tiles to change except 1 square in the middle of his nose. I ran out of time on my first attempt, and on the second attempt, I tried every which way but loose before giving up :(


[b]Carney Hidden Objects-Multiples of the Same Object[/b]
Another new feature is a Hidden Object variety where you must find multiples of two different items in a scene featuring a Carnival worker, such as 10 Lightning Bolts and 10 Spades. In theory, this sounds like a simple task but these items are blended into the scenery seamlessly....very challenging and fun!
 
[b]15 Chapters 15 Carneys[/b]
🎪The Amazing Larry
🎪Lucy the Bearded Lady
🎪Marlena the Mermaid
🎪Art the Carney
🎪Twyla Tangle the Contortionist
🎪Bianca the Daredevil Diva
🎪Fabiano the World's Strongest Man
🎪Lance the Sword Swallower
🎪Armando the Ringmaster
🎪Tabitha the Lion Tamer
🎪Franco the Excessive
🎪Dr. Goodwell the Medicine Man
🎪Puddles the Clown
🎪Dante the Tattooed Man
🎪Mao & Amber Tan the Acrobats

author: {'steamid': '76561198062678111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1700099371}
review:
I have Window 11, and it worked fine.  I recommend it if you want a game whose focus is HOPs and puzzles.  These aren't just any puzzles.  They are more like busy boxes.  You have to just start poking and prodding  until something moves and then try to figure you what you're supposed to do.  It actually took me 15 hours to play. You can choose a relaxed mode that gives you  a lot more time to play (I never ran out of time on it).  

The puzzles/mini games do not have instructions  which is a shame because they are so fun, original, and interesting.  Your only choice is to skip if you can't figure it out.  The hints come in the form of a little picture which may or may not be helpful.  

The artwork is very professional. 

If you like tons of hidden objects and puzzles that are challenging and will test your brain, this game is for you.

review: This game is old, but one of my favorites.  The puzzles are hard because there are no directions, and you have to figure it,  out.  You have the option to skip.  Its' challenging, too because you only get five hints per round and theres a whole lot of search scenes involved.  If you like challenge this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142811510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1691610069}
review:
Having played and loved other Mystery Case Files games, I like find the object games. Its a favorite pass-time.

This one introduces mini games that you have to beat to get access to the object-find pictures as well as to solve each investigation. Many are word based or puzzle based instead of object finding. FOR ME, it detracts from the main game. I don't like word based puzzles, they aren't what I bought this game to play. If you like them, and you like switching up what you doing--you'll probably love this. 

I will also say that the find the object pictures are the same high quality, imaginative and fun "maps" we have enjoyed from this series. I just don't like the word games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977507555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1670262611}
review:
Caveat emptor is what comes to my mind on these games.

This is a hidden object game, and if you are looking for a hidden object game, this might work for you.  
They are high quality hidden object puzzles and are fun to do...

BUT

(My issues with these games)
1. As a casual game, having a countdown timer makes them less "casual" than they should be.  It takes the fun out of trying to find the hidden objects, makes the player rush through the puzzles, and they miss the details and effort that went into the graphics.  It wouldn't be that big of an issue but when you run out of time, you have to start over and do all the hidden object puzzles in the current section over to advance the story.
2. Every game starting in full-screen mode is also irritating.  I understand that these games are old (from 2007 on), but full-screen 800x600 was crazy even back in 2007.  (NOTE: Not all of the games are 800x600.  the newer games (post 2012) are 16x9 resolution)
3. I don't know why these games don't close but when you "quit" the game keeps "running" according to Steam.  This isn't a deal-breaker but irritating.

Overall, I keep thinking about Caveat emptor and how I should have played the first game I picked up before buying the whole sets of the games.

Thankfully, I got them on sale.

Summary:
Beautiful graphics and artwork.
High quality audio.

Timed "casual" game

The game play (timers) ruined these games for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847515237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1584288599}
review:
unkike other MCF games like 13 sculls there was no "investagating" aspect to it it was a hidden object with an anoying time limit.and not much story. did not enjoy

i did not have a problem with the fullscreen problem tho. for those stuck without the fullscreen go into game settings  fullscreen is an option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824327050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1700716484}
review: Very nostalgic, unique suspects and surely Madame Fate knows what will happen at the stroke of 12 😏

author: {'steamid': '76561198018643787', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1562614258}
review:
Played this game ages ago and fell in love. When I saw it was on sale on Steam, I jumped at the chance to download it. Unfortunately, I cannot play this game in full screen mode. It remains a small screen, only positioned in the top left hand corner of the screen. For hidden object games, no full screen means impossible to play efficiently. Discussion boards have only shown me Big Fish is not interested in fixing this issue.

Do not recommend - at least on Windows XP. Not sure if the issue carries over to other operating systems.

Great game, otherwise, from what I remember. Interesting puzzles, stunning images, and fun characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034193738', 'num_games_owned': 2535, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1554096564}
review:
[b]Mystery Case Files 4: Madame Fate [/b](HOG)

Options include separate sliders for Music, SFX and Environment.  Choice of difficulty between Detective Mode (timed) and Relaxed (which will give you extra time).

[b]NOTE: [/b]The Steam version will NOT go full-screen unless you change your desktop resolution to 800x600.  If you're still having trouble, try running as administrator, and you should be good to go.

Ah, the HOG's of yesteryear, when the games were truly a challenge, and items were really well-hidden.  Revisiting Madame Fate - the game that originally drew me into the world of hidden objects - was a real eye-opener.  The scenes we scour aren't just junk piles... Sometimes it's hard to tell that they are HOS at all!  Some of the items are beautifully-hidden, and truly hard to find.

Madame Fate has foreseen her own demise.  Collect clues on 15 employees at Fate's Carnival, and help her find the culprit before it is too late!

For each carnival worker, you will search multiple scenes until you find enough clues to present to Madame Fate.  If you're having trouble with one location, just go to the map and jump to another location for a while. Some locations have zoom-in areas that have their own full-length lists.

There is some light interaction at times (ie. put the puzzle pieces in place before you can collect it), and other times you'll need to find 10 of one item.  While you're sleuthing, keep an eye out for [b]morphing items[/b]... When you collect enough, you'll unlock new locations!

FINDING MORPHING ITEMS WILL EARN YOU A HINT if you have less than five available.

In this fourth installment of the MCF series, you can at last find multiple items in succession... As a matter of fact, finding items quickly back-to-back will net you a time bonus!  Woo woo!  Be careful with rapid misclicks, though, as you'll earn yourself a time penalty.

For each staff member you investigate, you'll do one word puzzle-type of game, as well as a modified "door lock".  Unlike Ravenhearst, these puzzles are actually really difficult - you're going to have to use your brain to figure these out!

The graphics are bright and colorful, and the cast of characters comically memorable.  Madame Fate interacts with you often, and her voice acting is very well done.

This is not an easy game, but I highly recommend it to those who enjoy challenging themselves.  Use yer brain, eh!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990817752', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1635369952}
review:
Мне всегда нравились и будут нравится 2 игры серии: Ravenherst и Madame за неповторимую атмосферу.
Тут нет больших синематиков, нет ставшего классикой таких игр квестовой линейки, есть только несколько комнат с повторяющимися предметами, но...они интересные и атмосферные!
Вас не ведут за ручку, вам не нужно носиться по общей карте и тыкать качергу, топор и гвоздодер по всем щелям, а порой вас просто запирают на локации и тут уж только дурак не догадается, что доску с гвоздем нужно чик..того..самого...

В нынешних играх предмет, который нужно найти - это действительно именно то, что написано, но в ранних MCF это может быть всё, что угодно! Предметы могут быть полупрозрачными, могут быть частью картины, могут лежать в уголке на другой поверхности повторяя ее контуры! А как я люблю уровни с загадками! И как ненавижу многие загадки в новых играх! Например в старом Ravenherst нужно включить подачу топлива, расставить значки в соответствии с контекстом, вскипятить воду и тд. В новом собрать комбинацию цветных взаимозаменяемых шариков или протыкать лабиринт, повернув в нужном месте пару уголков. Причем все эти загадки с выставлением предметов в правильном порядке нудные и противные. Я это к тому, что сейчас дико усреднили порог вхождения.

Разрешение кстати довольно маленькое, без настроек масштабирования можно наблюдать окошко в левой части экрана.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972999224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1547869336}
review: Honestly didn't like it. Whole game felt like a chore. For some reason while fullscreen worked on the last entry of this serries, it did not work on this one. The game has a vague connection to the last game in the serries but that only becomes evident when you beat it. Puzzle were unique but sometimes very annoying. Also there are various items that change between two objects to unlock. You can only do them when a certain scene appears. So if you miss one, well, play again i guess. Tunnel of love is a culprit. I only remember seeing it once and i missed it. And occasionally madame fate will start talking during a scene, which gets old real fast when your squinting trying to find objects in a small window.  I wouldn't reccomend it by itself but if you bought the serries or want to play them all in order then have at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366889553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1546383899}
review: Don't buy this unless you like to tinker with your display.  It only runs small unless you change your settings for the screen display to 600x800, which is a total downer.  Frankly, I think I shall ask for a refund, as this is not what I wanted to do with my scarce spare time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176301233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1534768107}
review: In windows 10, full screen doesn't work. Playing in the small window provided makes all the objects you have to find extremely, extremely small. Then there is the stupid timer - I'm not a fan of timers and this game doesn't change that. There doesn't seem to be much of a plot other than finding objects. And the last straw is having Madame Fate constantly saying things - like "move faster", "that's not it" etc etc while you are looking for the teeny tiny objects. So annoying that I'm  not going to finish playing. Avoid this one if you have windows 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047527390', 'num_games_owned': 10863, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1335337200}
review:
몇년 전에 했던것 같은데 이제서야 리뷰를 씁니다.

숨은그림찾기 베이스인데 스토리도 탄탄하구요.
중간 중간에 들어있는 미니 퍼즐 같은게 꽤 괜찮습니다.
제 플레이 타임을 보면 아시듯이 분량도 적지 않구요.

하지만 가격은 할인 할때 저는 샀지만...
원가는 숨은 그림 찾기 치고는 좀 비싼것 같네요.
업적이 없는게 너무 아쉬운 게임이었습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173131854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1488595877}
review: Good game.  The search and find puzzles were hard on my laptop as I had to move the screen around just to see the items and the puzzles that finished each "chapter" had no instructions so you had to figure it out on your own.  If you play the timed version and time ran out, you had to start at the beginning of the "chapter".  It was frustrating, but the second (or third) time through went faster.  Yes, I would reccommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121418210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1569623529}
review:
[h1]Alter Klassiker jetzt "Unzensiert"[/h1]

Vorweg. Madame Fate und ihr Carnival ist mein erstes wirklich grosses HOG Erlebnis gewesen. 
Dieses Spiel hat die Messlatte meiner Ansprüche danach sehr hoch gelegt. Wie (fast) alle Mystery Case Files danach auch. Meine Meinung ist deshalb sicherlich nicht neutral. 
Die [i]'Mystery Case File'[/i] Serie ist wohl eine der strahlendsten Perlen der Big Fish Publikationen.
Mit jedem Teil wurden neue (damals innovative) Elemente eingeführt. In späteren Teilen waren es interaktive Inventarobjekte oder eingefügte Realgesichter. 
[u]In diesem Spiel waren es Gestaltwechsel- oder Sammelobjekte. Und die 2. Wimmelbilder in den Wimmelbildern.[/u]
[b]Auch ist es das letzte reine 'Such- und Rätselspiel' der Reihe.
[u]Schon im Nachfolger "Return to Ravenhurst" wurden die heute gängigen Adventure-Elemente eingeführt[/u][/b]

Natürlich wirkt das Spiel Oldshoolmässig. Aber es hat auch schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel. Die Stimmung des Creepy Jahrmarktes verbreitet es imer noch gut. 
Und macht so auch noch beim -Zigsten Durchspielen Laune...
So sind "Hidden Expeditions Amazonas" & "Madame Fate" die beiden HOGs mit dem höchsten Wiederspielwert auf meinem Rechner.
[i]Ach ja: Besonders zu erwähnen sind auch die Kapitelabschluss-Rätsel... Immer wieder kleine Schmuckstücke an Rätselbildern...[/i]

[b]Hier jetzt noch besonders für alle, die das Spiel noch von früher kennen (könnten ja ein paar sein):
Für die deutschsprachige Adaption wurden ein paar Worträtsel einfach weggelassen, die sind jetzt hier natürlich in der Originalsprachausgabe enthalten!!! Allein deshalb lohnt sich auch der nostalgische "Wiederkauf"[/b] 

Für Englischunkundige ist das natürlich eher ein abschreckendes Argument. Oder Ansporn ihr Englisch damit aufzupolieren.... Spielend sozusagen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198004423189', 'num_games_owned': 4447, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1643409030}
review:
После трюка с отключением скалирования в видеодровах (и установки совместимости с WinXP), мне таки удалось поиграть.

12 подозреваемых в преступлении, десяток локаций, поиск предметов, которые не всегда однозначно выглядят так, как вы от них ожидаете. Очередной MCF. В общем, это more of the same, так что если вы уже видели предыдущие игры - рекомендую не форсировать прохождение, или задолбает вусмерть (я её примерно два месяца играл - 11 часов - и то ближе к концу уже стал уставать). К начальной схеме добавились ещё уникальные головоломки, для каждого из подозреваемых, а финал неожиданно объединяет игру с предыдущей и последующей.

В целом - вполне. Сохранилась гораздо лучше, чем можно было бы ожидать.

---старый обзор---
На моей системе (Windows 10 x64) идёт исключительно в окошке 800х600. Учитывая моё не самое лучшее зрение и разрешение экрана 1920х1080 - это не очень комфортно.

Ах, да, ещё в случайные моменты времени после попытки её выключить, Steam Web Helper зависает, и игра остаётся "играть" бесконечно, пока не снимешь нужную службу (нет, выйти из Стима не получится).

author: {'steamid': '76561198060069971', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1482617423}
review:
Serinin dördüncü oyununda bu kez karnavalda geçiyor madame fate adanıda olan kadın 12 kişiden şüpheleniyor ve gece yarısı saat 12 olmadan bulmamızı istiyor ve 12 kişi araştırıyoruz.

Oyun bazı değişiklik oldu 
-Hint sayısı 5 tane oldu
-Dönüşümlü nesneler geldi (armut halinde direk elmaya dönüşüyor) bunları bulduğumuzda bazı gizli yerler açıyor ve her nesne bulduğunuzda süre artıyor
-Eşyayı üç tane ardada bulduğunuzda süre artıyor.
-puzzle çoğu orta derecede ama final puzzle insanı kafayı yedirir söyleyim ben bile kafayı yedim video izleyerek tamamladım.
Herkese iyi eğlenceler :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035387898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1499689006}
review: A very whimsical, yet fun, hidden object game. Best in short bursts, and great for winding down or for mindless fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2746, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1451169291}
review:
Yeah, I couldn't resist buying this at full price but if I wanted to follow the Ravenhearst story-arc, I needed it.

In MCF: Madame Fate, after freeing Emma's spirit from Ravenhearst, Madame Fate contacted you as she saw her own demise in her crystal ball - she needs you to find who among her employees wants her dead....

And you'll ask me: why is it tied to Ravenhearst? Because the storyline has a huge twist at the end, that will make you go back to Ravenhearst Manor in the fifth installement of the series.

You're now visiting a fair, along with people: you'll have a number of items to find in order to access to the future of the employees (doomed, doomed and doomed.... anyway). Each scene contains also beyond objects items (changing appearances) that will unlock special places where you can gain time - mainly if you're in the normal mode where you have a timer.

When visiting an employee, you'll have a puzzle of words to solve, each time different in the thematic. Then, there, you'll have to find specific items (5 clubs, 10 moons, 15 jelly beans, etc...).

And when you want to reveal their fate, well, you'll have a puzzle to solve - an elaborate one as sometimes, it's hard to see what to do.

As you understand, Madame Fate, while being in the first era of hidden objects games, has a tendancy to orient itself towards modern "hidden objects" games: beyond objects, puzzles, and hidden objects scenes in a scene.

However, I felt the game being long for a simple reason: you have many employees to check AND some objects are so well hidden that you'll need a magnifying lens to see them. Also, as the game is in English only, I had an hard time for the puzzle words (I don't know all the fruit in English or even the feelings) and for some items, like a dolly, where I was searching for a doll when it was something else (a tool used to carry boxes or crates). So in other words, Madame Fate isn't opened to everyone, at least on Steam. If you want a multilanguage game, you need to find it elsewhere or in retail.

Madame Fate's ambiance, however, is between cynism and dark humor. It's perhaps less creepy than Ravenhearst, the previous game, but there is still evil lurking around and the fair Madame Fate owned isn't the most joyful in the world.

Anyway, it's still a good game, a good moment to pass just to know the fate of the employees and who wants to kill her. I spent 10 bucks that I'm not regretting, however, you should prefer a discount on it, that will perhaps happen one day, as Ravenhearst and Return to Ravenhearst were during this sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035864285', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1656398446}
review: Out of all the Mystery Case File Games - I recommend this one the most. The only bummer is that there are no Steam achievements to unlock with this game.
